text:
WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN FARMERS EAT?

A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name ............................................ Taken from my father's old account book. Book kept in 1873.

Address ............................................ Armstrong

Birthplace ............................................ Holland

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1873

Where did you set up housekeeping? South end of Armstrong

Where had you been living before that? Scotland

For how many people did you prepare meals? 6

How far was it to your nearest store? 40 miles to Whitewood

How often could a visit be made to the store? Twice a year

What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?
Sugar, tea, coffee beans, syrup, oats, flour

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? XXXX

In what quantities did you buy it? Large quantities & eggs

That was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $2.90

How much did you use graham flour? XXXX

Whole wheat flour? XXXX

Was flour milled locally? Yes

How far away? XXXX What year? 1876

That was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? XXXX

What other grain products did you use?

Cornmeal? XXXX Whole wheat? XXXX Farina? XXXX

Other? XXXX

Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? No

How did you grind it? XXXX
WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name: John Wilson
Address: Springside
Birthplace: Scotland

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1883
Where did you set up housekeeping? 5 miles southwest of Hatton
Where had you been living before that? Scotland
For how many people did you prepare meals? 6
How far was it to your nearest store? 40 miles to Waterton
How often could a visit be made to the store? Twice a year
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?
Sugar tea coffee beans syrup salt flour

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? XXXX
In what quantities did you buy it? Large quantities 9 bags
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $2.80
How much did you use Graham flour? XXXX
Whole wheat flour? XXXX
Was flour milled locally? Millwood
How far away? XXXX What year? 1886
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? XXXX
What other grain products did you use?
Cornmeal? XXXX Whole wheat? XXXX Farina? XXXX
Other? XXXX
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? No
How did you grind it?
1883. Wilson, John Springside.

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONING

What year did you start housekeeping in eastern Canada?
Where did you get your housekeeping supplies?
How many people did you manage to keep?
How far was it to your nearest store?
How often could a visit be made to the store?
What provisions did you usually buy in those earliest years?

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of flour did you use in the early years?
In what quantities did you buy flour?
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of wheat flour?
How much did you use wheat flour?
Was flour milled locally?
What was the price for a twenty-five pound bag of rolled oats?
What other grain products did you use?
Cornmeal?
Oats?
Did you grind your own meal?
3. SUGARS AND SYRUPS

In what quantity did you buy white sugar? ...........................................
What was the price for a ten pound sack of white sugar? .....................
What brand of golden corn syrup did you use? ..................................
What size of tin of syrup did you usually buy? ..................................
At what price? ...................................................................................

4. DAIRY PRODUCTS

How did you get a supply of fresh milk in the early days? ......................
.......................................................... eggs? ........................................
butter? .................................................. eggs? ........................................
What was the price of butter? ......................................................
Did you pick eggs for winter? ......................................................
Did you make butter? ...................................................... cheese? ........
What kind of cheese? ......................................................................

5. MEAT AND FISH

What was your meat supply in the early years? ..................................
.......................................................... How did you get fresh meat? ....
.......................................................... How often did you get fresh meat? ........................................
.......................................................... How did you preserve meat? ........................................
Was there a "beef ring" in your neighborhood? ..................................
If so what year was it organized? ..................................................
Did you use game? .................................................. What kinds? ........
For how long? ................................................................................
That part did fish play in the family diet? ........................................
Was the fish fresh, cured, or canned? ................................................
Kinds? ...................................................................................
3. **SUGAR AND SWEETS**

In what quantity did you buy **sugar**?  
That was the price for a ten pound sack of **white sugar**?  
What brand of **golden corn syrup** did you use?  
What size of tin or syrup did you usually buy?  
At what price?

4. **DAIRY PRODUCTS**

How did you get a supply of fresh milk in the early days?  
**Herd cheese**  
That was the name of **butter**?  
Did you pack eggs for storage?  
Did you make butter?  
What kind of cheese?

5. **MEAT AND FISH**

What was your meat supply in the early years?  
**Pork and Ribs**  
How did you get fresh meat?  
How often did you get fresh meat?  
For did you purchase meat?  
Was there a "meat shop" in your neighborhood?  
If so, what was it called?  
Did you use **milk**?  
For how long?  
What part did fish play in the family diet?  
Was the fish **fresh**, **cured**, or canned?  
Was the fish **trout**, **salmon**, or **cod**?  
**Klams?**
6. BEVERAGES

What kind of tea did you buy? ... Lipton ... At what price? ... 45¢ ...
What kind of coffee did you buy? (beans or ground) ... ground ...
Price? ... 3¢ per lb ... What other beverages were used? ... tea ...

7. VEGETABLES AND DRIED FRUITS

What was the price of potatoes per bushel when you set up housekeeping? ... 11¢ ...
Could you get potatoes at the store? ... yes ...
If not, where from? ... garden ...
What year did you first grow your own supply for the winter of? ... 1884 ...
Potatoes ... 4¢ ... Cabbage ... 2¢ ... Carrots ... 4¢ ... Onions ... 2¢ ...
Turnips ... 4¢ ... Beets ... 4¢ ...
In what quantities did you buy white navy beans? ... 10 lbs ...
How did you buy prunes, (in bulk or by the box)? ... by box ...
What weight? ... 20 lbs ... How did the grocer handle prunes (by box)? ... 20 lbs ...
What was the price of prunes? ... 5¢ ...
What other dried fruits did you use in the earliest days? (apples, pears, apricots, peaches, loganberries, raisins, currents or others)? ... dried apples ...

8. PRESERVING

In the early years did you preserve any foods by drying? ... yes ...
peas? ... no ... corn? ... yes ... beans? ... yes ... Saskatoons? ... yes ...
other foods? ... yes ...
What year did you first preserve fruit by canning? ... 1896 ...
What year did you first preserve vegetables by canning? ... 1896 ...
What year did you first preserve meat by canning? ... 1896 ...
Do you still preserve foods by canning or drying? ... yes ...
To what extent? ... canned tomatoes, fruit, pickled vegetables ...
Did you make your own vinegar? ... yes ...
6. **BUYING**

   - What kind of tea did you buy?  
     - Green tea
     - Black tea
     - Other

   - How much did you pay per pound?  
     - $1.50

   - What kind of coffee did you buy?  
     - Ground
     - Whole bean

   - How much did you pay per pound?  
     - $2.00

7. **VEGETABLES**

   - If not, where from?
   - That year did you grow your own supply for the table or for sale?

   | Vegetable | Quantity | Price |
   |-----------|----------|-------|
   | Potatoes  | 100      | $1.00 |
   | Carrots   | 50       | $0.50 |
   | Turnips    | 50       | $0.50 |
   | Cabbage   | 50       | $0.50 |
   | Beets     | 50       | $0.50 |

   - In what quantities did you buy?  
     - 1 lb
     - 5 lbs
     - 10 lbs

   - How did you buy produce?  
     - In bulk
     - By the box

   - What variety?  
     - Red
     - Green

   - How did the grocer handle produce (by box)?  
     - Yes
     - No

   - What was the price of produce?  
     - $0.50

   - What other dried fruits did you use in the earliest days?  
     - Apples
     - Peaches

8. **PRESERVATION**

   - In the early years did you preserve any produce by canning?
     - Yes
     - No

   - Other methods?
     - Corn
     - Beans
     - Squash

   - That year did you first preserve fruit by canning?
     - Yes
     - No

   - To what extent?
     - Extensive
     - Minimal

   - How many pounds of produce did you can in the first year?
     - 100 lbs

Where did you get water for drinking and for cooking? (well, river, slough, dugout) ..................................................................

There did you not water for drinking and for cooking? (i.e., river, stream, dugout)

If so far was this water from your house? ________ feet ________ feet ________

How was it brought to the house? (well, barrel, tank)

Was any other water supply mentioned which have taken place since you first started homesteading, giving dates where possible.

First started homesteading ________
13. SOAP

Did you buy laundry soap or make your own? ......................... wood ashes?

If you made your own, did you use lye? ........... wood ashes?

What kinds of laundry soap did the grocer handle? .........................

14. FUEL

What fuel did you use in the earliest days? ......................... wood

Where did you get your fuel? ......................... wood

Mention any changes in the use of fuels which have taken place since you first started housekeeping, giving dates where possible.

15. METHODS OF COOKING AND TYPES OF UTENSILS

For cooking, did you use an indoor fireplace or open hearth in the earliest days? (Give dates) ............. always had a cook stove

Did you use an outdoor fireplace or bake oven? (Give dates) .........................

By whom was your first cook stove made? ............ built a long ago

What year was it purchased? ......................... Price? .........................

What types of utensils did you use? (iron, copper, tin, homemade) .........................

For preparing food? (china, earthenware, wooden bowls, other) .........................

When did you first see enamel ware? .........................

Aluminum? ..................................
13. **FIRE**
   - Did you buy firewood last year? Yes/No
   - If so, did you use it all? Yes/No
   - If not, did you sell any? Yes/No

14. **FUEL**
   - What fuel did you use in the winter last year? (Specify)
   - Have you used your wood stove? Yes/No
   - Mention any changes in the use of fuel which have taken place since you first started using wood.

15. **HEATING**
   - Do you have central heating? Yes/No
   - If so, what type? (Specify)
   - Do you have a hot water system? Yes/No
   - If so, how many gallons? (Specify)

16. **FIREPLACE**
   - Do you have a fireplace? Yes/No
   - If so, what type? (Specify)
   - Do you use it regularly? Yes/No
   - If not, why not? (Specify)

17. **COOKSTOVE**
   - Do you have a cookstove? Yes/No
   - If so, what type? (Specify)
   - Do you use it regularly? Yes/No
   - If not, why not? (Specify)

18. **WOOD STORAGE**
   - Do you store wood outside? Yes/No
   - If so, where? (Specify)
   - How much do you store? (Specify)

19. **WOOD USE**
   - Do you use wood for heating? Yes/No
   - If so, how much? (Specify)
   - Do you use wood for cooking? Yes/No
   - If so, how much? (Specify)

20. **WOOD PROCUREMENT**
   - Do you procure wood locally? Yes/No
   - If so, from whom? (Specify)
   - How much do you procure? (Specify)
16. SHAPPINGS AND CONTAINERS

Mention any changes which you recall in the wrappings and containers received with the food you purchased (give dates where possible).

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at this time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

| Breakfast | Oatmeal and toast and tea |
|-----------|--------------------------|
| Dinner    | Potatoes, rabbits and other vegetables |
| Supper    | Tea and hot biscuits and jam or syrup |

Father Mother Jennie 12 Will 10 John 8 James 6

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in eastern Canada? 1884

Give the menu. List those present and give their approximate ages at that time.

Roast Beef, vegetable and plum pudding and turkey

Our family and Mrs. Raymont and son Lynn and Mrs. Raymont further I can't give their ages

19. Were you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details.

Only once when the snow was so deep we could not get out. We divided the flour up and each one got just a stroke of bread three times a day. But we always had rabbits which helped a lot. It was a mile to the nearest house. The man then walked over on his snow shoes to see us... so came back the next day and brought some flour.
17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. Also list the approximate monthly rent, water tax, etc.

Breakfast: 
- Oatmeal and toast
- Tea and hot chocolate
- Apples

Dinner:
- Roast beef, Yorkshire pudding, and turnips
- Gravy
- Potatoes

Supper:
- Fish and chips
- Salad

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in Canada? 1884

19. How did you feel when the snow came down?

And straightened out again
20. Mention any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the earliest days as compared with today.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of homestead and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible).

22. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying groceries and securing foods in other ways during pioneer days in Western Canada. Include items not mentioned above, quality, methods of merchandising, prices, problems of storage, shortages and other details. [Use back of page if more space is needed].
21. Than did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of home grown and home prepared foods (Give an early date and dates as possible).

22. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying, growing, and storing foods in your pioneer days in Eastern Canada. Include items not covered above, such as methods of merchandising, for prices, problems of storage, shortages, etc., if any.
